net.kuujo.copycat.transport

Interface Server

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalServer, NettyServer

    public interface Server
    Transport server.

    This is a low-level abstraction through which Copycat servers receive connections from clients. Users should never use this API directly.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Void> close()
      Closes the server.
      UUID id()
      Returns the server ID.
      CompletableFuture<Void> listen(InetSocketAddress address, Listener<Connection> listener)
      Listens for connections on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        UUID id()
        Returns the server ID.

        The server ID is a globally unique UUID through which the server can be identified.

        Returns:
        The server ID.

      • listen

        CompletableFuture<Void> listen(InetSocketAddress address,
                               Listener<Connection> listener)
        Listens for connections on the server.

        Once the server has started listening on the provided address, Listener.accept(Object) will be called for the provided Listener each time a new connection to the server is established. The provided connection's Connection.id() will reflect the Client.id() of the client that connected to the server and not the id() of the server itself.

        Once the server has bound to the provided address the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        Parameters:
        address - The address on which to listen for connections.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be called once the server has started listening for connections.

      • close

        CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Closes the server.

        When the server is closed, any close listeners registered on the server's Connections will be invoked prior to shutdown.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the server is closed.
